Package ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy

Enum WordPolicy.Hint

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<WordPolicy.Hint>
      • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.WordPolicy.Hint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<WordPolicy.Hint>
    Enclosing interface:
    WordPolicy
    public static enum WordPolicy.Hint
extends Enum<WordPolicy.Hint>
    A policy hint can be used to modify the behaviour of the spell checker.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      ADJACENT_KEY_CAPS

      WORD_REGEX

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • EDIT_DISTANCE_LIMIT

        public static final WordPolicy.Hint EDIT_DISTANCE_LIMIT
        This hint suggests how dissimilar a suggestion can be to a misspelled word. For example, "aple" can be changed to "apple" in 1 edit, and to "applet" in two edits. If this policy was set to 1, "applet" would not be a valid suggestion for "aple."

        Type: Integer (must have a positive value)
        Default: 3

      • ADJACENT_KEY_CAPS

        public static final WordPolicy.Hint ADJACENT_KEY_CAPS
        This hint returns an array of strings representing the arrangement of letter keys on a standard keyboard under this policy. Each string in the array represents one row of letter keys; the characters in each row are the capitalized key caps of the letters in that row, in the order they occur on the keyboard.

        Type: String[] (must be non-null)
        Default: ["QWERTYUIOP", "ASDFGHJKL", "ZXCVBNM"]

      • WORD_REGEX

        public static final WordPolicy.Hint WORD_REGEX
        This hint provides a regular expression that can be used to identify words to be checked. Group 1 of the expression must contain the text of the word.

        Type: Pattern
        Default: 

        (\p{L}+[\p{L}\']*\p{L}+)
